intro: Pappobolus argenteus, commonly known as the silver pappobolus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow florets arranged in a disk-like structure, surrounded by bracts that give it a fluffy appearance. Its silver-gray foliage is a distinguishing feature, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Pappobolus argenteus is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
